intro: Pedicularis striata, commonly known as the spotted lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with contrasting markings. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in whorls around the stem. Pedicularis striata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
